MountainCar.cc

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************************
00002  *  MountainCar.cpp
00003  *  
00004  *  Created by Adam White, created on March 29 2007.
00005  *  Copyright (c) 2005 UAlberta. All rights reserved.
00006  *
00007  *  Description.
00008  *
00009  *              The Standard Mountain Car, given in Figure 8.8 of the book 
00010  *              "Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction", by Sutton and Barto.
00011  *
00012  *      http://www.cs.ualberta.ca/%7Esutton/book/ebook/node89.html
00013  *
00014  *              The environment program implements the dynamics described in Sutton 
00015  *              and Barto. Except, that the environment program allows episodes to begin 
00016  *              with the car at the bottom of the hill with zero velocity or with the 
00017  *              car at a random position and velocity. This is controlled by a flag in 
00018  *              MCcar_common.h.
00019  *
00020  *              Episodic Task
00021  *              Reward: -1 per step
00022  *              Actions: Discrete
00023  *                                      0 - reverse 
00024  *                                      1 - coast 
00025  *                                      2 - forward 
00026  *              State: 2D Continuous
00027  *                                      car's x-position (-1.2 to .6)
00028  *                                      car's velocity (-.7 to .7)
00029  *                                      
00030  ********************************************************************************/
00031 
00032 // env_ function prototypes types 
00033 #include <rlglue/Environment_common.h>    
00034 
00035 // helpful functions for allocating structs and cleaning them up 
00036 #include <rlglue/utils/C/RLStruct_util.h> 
00037 
00038 #include <cmath>
00039 #include <iterator>
00040 #include <sstream>
00041 
00042 namespace {
00043   //State variables
00044   double mcar_position;
00045   double mcar_velocity;
00046   
00047   const int max_steps = 1000000;
00048   int current_num_steps;
00049 
00050   const int state_size = 2;
00051   const int num_actions = 3;
00052 
00053   const double mcar_min_position = -1.2;
00054   const double mcar_max_position = 0.6;
00055   const double mcar_goal_position = 0.5;
00056   const double mcar_max_velocity = 0.07;            // the negative of this is also the minimum velocity
00057 
00058   //Create instances of RL-Glue types
00059   observation_t current_observation;
00060   reward_observation_terminal_t ro;
00061 
00062   const bool use_random_start = true;
00063 }
00064 
00065 //helper functions
00066 void test_termination();  
00067 void set_initial_position_random();
00068 void set_initial_position_at_bottom();
00069 void update_velocity(const action_t *a);
00070 void update_position();
00071 
00072 const char *env_init()
00073 {
00074   // Handle RL Glue stuff.
00075   allocateRLStruct(&current_observation, 0, 2, 0);
00076   std::fill(current_observation.doubleArray,
00077             current_observation.doubleArray + current_observation.numDoubles,
00078             0);
00079   ro.observation = &current_observation;
00080   ro.terminal = 0;
00081   ro.reward = 0.0;      
00082 
00083   std::stringstream response;
00084   response << "VERSION RL-Glue-3.0 PROBLEMTYPE episodic DISCOUNTFACTOR 1 ";
00085   response << "OBSERVATIONS DOUBLES (" << mcar_min_position << " "
00086            << mcar_max_position << ") (" << -mcar_max_velocity
00087            << " " << mcar_max_velocity << ") ";
00088   response << "ACTIONS INTS (0 " << num_actions - 1 << ") ";
00089   response << "REWARDS (-1 0) ";
00090   response << "EXTRA MountainCar implemented by Adam White, updated to RL-Glue 3.0 by Nicholas K. Jong.";
00091   static std::string buffer;
00092   buffer = response.str();
00093   return buffer.c_str();
00094 }
00095 
00096 const observation_t *env_start()
00097 {
00098   if (use_random_start)
00099     set_initial_position_random();
00100   else
00101     set_initial_position_at_bottom();
00102   
00103   current_observation.doubleArray[0] = mcar_position;
00104   current_observation.doubleArray[1] = mcar_velocity;
00105         
00106   ro.reward = 0.0;
00107   ro.terminal =0;
00108 
00109   current_num_steps = 0;
00110         
00111   return &current_observation;
00112 }
00113 
00114 const reward_observation_terminal_t *env_step(const action_t *a)   
00115 {       
00116   current_num_steps++;
00117 
00118   update_velocity(a);
00119   update_position();
00120         
00121   ro.reward = -1;
00122                 
00123   test_termination();
00124 
00125   current_observation.doubleArray[0] = mcar_position;
00126   current_observation.doubleArray[1] = mcar_velocity;
00127                     
00128   return &ro;
00129 }   
00130 
00131 void env_cleanup()
00132 {
00133   clearRLStruct(&current_observation);
00134 }
00135 
00136 const char *env_message(const char *_inMessage) {
00137   std::stringstream response;
00138   std::stringstream message(_inMessage);
00139 
00140   // Tokenize the message
00141   std::istream_iterator<std::string> it(message);
00142   std::istream_iterator<std::string> end;
00143   
00144   while (it != end) {
00145     std::string command(*it++);
00146     if (command.compare("set-random-seed") == 0) {
00147       if (it == end) {
00148         response << "MountainCar received set-random-seed with no argument.\n";
00149       } else {
00150         std::string seed_string(*it++);
00151         int seed = atoi(seed_string.c_str());
00152         srand48(seed);
00153         response << "MountainCar set random seed to " << seed << ".\n";
00154       }
00155     } else {
00156       response << "MountainCar did not understand '" << command << "'.\n";
00157     }
00158   }
00159 
00160   static std::string buffer;
00161   buffer = response.str();
00162   return buffer.c_str();
00163 }
00164 
00165 //Helper functions ----------------------------------------------
00166 void test_termination()  
00167 {
00168   if (mcar_position >= mcar_goal_position) 
00169     ro.terminal = 1; //True
00170   else if(current_num_steps > max_steps)
00171     ro.terminal = 1; //true
00172   else
00173     ro.terminal = 0;
00174 }
00175 
00176 void set_initial_position_at_bottom()
00177 {
00178   mcar_position = -M_PI/6.0; 
00179   mcar_velocity = 0.0; 
00180 }
00181 
00182 void set_initial_position_random()
00183 {
00184   mcar_position = (drand48()*(mcar_goal_position + fabs(mcar_min_position)) + mcar_min_position);
00185   mcar_velocity = (drand48()*(mcar_max_velocity*2) - mcar_max_velocity);
00186 }
00187 
00188 
00189 void update_velocity(const action_t *action)
00190 {
00191   mcar_velocity += (action->intArray[0]-1)*0.001 + cos(3*mcar_position)*(-0.0025);
00192   if (mcar_velocity > mcar_max_velocity) mcar_velocity = mcar_max_velocity;
00193   if (mcar_velocity < -mcar_max_velocity) mcar_velocity = -mcar_max_velocity;
00194 }
00195 
00196 void update_position()
00197 {
00198   mcar_position += mcar_velocity;
00199   if (mcar_position > mcar_max_position) mcar_position = mcar_max_position;
00200   if (mcar_position < mcar_min_position) mcar_position = mcar_min_position;
00201   if (mcar_position==mcar_min_position && mcar_velocity<0) mcar_velocity = 0;   
00202 }
